summary: A detailed exploration of Oumuamua, the first interstellar object observed in our solar system, highlighting its unusual characteristics, possible origins, and the scientific debate surrounding its nature.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a black and white image of a starry sky, featuring a bright star at the top center and a smaller, circled object below it, surrounded by numerous other stars. The text "R. Wainscoat, CFHT data" appears in yellow at the bottom right corner, indicating the source of the image. The scene then transitions to a computer-generated animation of a planetary system, showcasing a central star with concentric rings representing planetary orbits. The text "Planetary Migration Simulation" appears in white at the bottom left, along with the names "Konstantin Batygin, Michael E. Brown, Wesley C. Fraser" and "California Institute of Technology," crediting the creators and their affiliation. The animation depicts the movement of celestial bodies within the system, with lines indicating their paths. The video then shifts to a black background with a single bright star in the center, surrounded by numerous smaller stars, creating a sense of depth and vastness in space. The overall atmosphere of the video is one of scientific exploration and visualization of cosmic phenomena.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with dramatic, suspenseful orchestral music, creating an ominous mood. A male speaker with a measured tone introduces a discussion about an object from another star system, emphasizing that pieces of other star systems can visit us, and "Oumuamua" is not what they expected. The music fades slightly as the speaker states they will begin with what they know.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a black screen displaying the text '2016.45' in the bottom right corner, transitioning to a starry night sky with a bright comet moving across the frame, leaving a trail behind it. The text '2016.90' appears, indicating a passage of time. The comet continues its journey, and the text '2017.36' is shown, marking another time lapse. The scene then shifts to a person in a blue hoodie holding a white object, possibly a pen, in front of a bookshelf filled with books and a colorful map on the wall. The video then returns to space, showing a detailed image of a comet with the text 'CREDIT: ESO/M. KORNMESSER' at the bottom, highlighting the comet's texture and features. The comet is shown from various angles, emphasizing its elongated shape and surface details. The video concludes with a diagram of a solar system, illustrating the orbits of planets and the comet's trajectory, with a red line indicating its path.
events_list.audio_caption: An informative male speaker begins describing an object that entered our solar system, traveling at high speed. He elaborates on its varying brightness, introducing the "cigar hypothesis" and noting its unusual tumbling motion. He adds that this object has a 10-to-1 length-to-width ratio, which is atypical in our solar system. The speaker suggests the object is made of sturdy material to maintain its unique shape and that it brushed close to Earth. He mentions that it entered the habitable zone of our sun. Finally, he suggests that the weirdest bit of all is that... the clip ends abruptly.

A spacecraft is shown in space, with a bright light source and a planet in the background, highlighting the vastness of space. events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker describing a situation where something's velocity changed inexplicably, attributing this to two possibilities: either it's a comet off-gassing or "a 50-meter square of shiny foil less than a millimeter thick," a solar sail, describing that it can use the Sun's momentum for propulsion. The speaker notes that it is something humans have experimented with before, questioning that it cannot be right. His tone is informative and speculative.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a mesmerizing view of a large asteroid floating in the vastness of space, illuminated by a distant star. The asteroid's rugged surface is detailed, and the surrounding space is dotted with stars and faint lines representing orbital paths. As the scene transitions, the asteroid starts to emit a plume of smoke or gas, suggesting some form of activity or interaction. The focus then shifts to a person wearing a blue hoodie, seated in front of a bookshelf filled with various books and collectibles. The individual appears to be speaking, using hand gestures to emphasize their points. The background includes a colorful map on the wall, adding a vibrant touch to the setting. The person continues to speak, with their expressions and gestures indicating an engaging and informative discussion. The video maintains a consistent indoor setting, with the bookshelf and map providing a stable backdrop throughout the sequence.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with one male speaker asserting that "a comet is a much more likely thing to have floating through interstellar space," but notes Oumuamua was initially thought not to be a comet due to its unusual shape. He mentions the challenges of maintaining such a shape in space, especially for loosely held objects like comets, and suggests it would likely break apart when approaching a gravitational well like the sun. The speaker sounds educational and conversational.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a celestial body, possibly a comet or asteroid, moving through space, leaving a trail of dust and gas behind it. The object is illuminated by a distant light source, likely a star, which casts a glow on its surface and the surrounding space. The scene transitions to a split-screen view of two spherical objects, possibly moons or planets, with one side of each object in shadow and the other side illuminated. The left object appears darker and more uniform in texture, while the right object is lighter and covered in craters and surface features. The video concludes with a close-up of the right object, highlighting its detailed surface and craters.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single male speaker discussing a celestial object and its brightness changes. He suggests that the variability "isn't caused by its unique shape," explaining that one side could simply be darker, like Saturn's moon Iapetus. He concludes that "maybe we've just learned that it isn't such a weird shape." His tone is informative and somewhat speculative. There are no other discernible sounds.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person wearing a blue hoodie with white drawstrings, seated in front of a bookshelf filled with various books and collectibles, including figurines and a framed map on the wall. The individual is engaged in a conversation or presentation, using hand gestures to emphasize points. The scene transitions to a space-themed animation, showcasing a bright sun with a dark planet or moon passing in front of it, creating a silhouette effect. The animation continues with a view of numerous asteroids floating in space, set against a backdrop of stars and a nebula, with the text 'science @ NASA' visible in the top right corner, indicating the source of the animation. The video then returns to the person in the blue hoodie, who continues to speak and gesture, maintaining the same background setting. The overall atmosphere is educational, with a focus on both the individual's presentation and the space-themed visuals.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single male speaker with a clear, informative tone discussing why an object was not identified as a comet, mentioning it had no tail. He explains the theoretical off-gassing of its mass and the potential differences in outgassing from comets in other solar systems. He concludes by mentioning scientists believe off-gassing would have changed the object's rotation. There are no detectable background noises or music.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a person wearing a blue hoodie, seated in front of a bookshelf filled with various books and collectibles, including figurines and a map on the wall. The individual appears to be speaking, as indicated by their hand gestures and facial expressions. The scene then transitions to a dramatic depiction of a spacecraft in space, surrounded by a fiery, red-hued environment that resembles a solar flare or intense heat. The spacecraft, with its large cylindrical body and intricate details, is shown in various angles, emphasizing its structure and the surrounding fiery atmosphere. The narrative continues with the spacecraft moving through space, now depicted against the backdrop of Earth, showcasing the planet's surface with clouds and landmasses. The spacecraft's journey is highlighted by its sleek design and the contrast between the fiery environment and the serene Earth below. The video concludes with the spacecraft floating in the vastness of space, surrounded by stars, emphasizing its isolation and the grandeur of the cosmos. The overall atmosphere of the video shifts from a personal, indoor setting to a visually stunning and dynamic portrayal of space exploration.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker adding to the solar sail hypothesis, mentioning the Spitzer Space Telescope pointed at Oumuamua's location, receiving no thermal readings back, meaning it was dim and reflected heat. His tone is informative and slightly conversational. He says this object has an upper limit on how dark it can be, "shinier than either asteroids or comets from our solar system". He then sarcastically thanks the Spitzer Space Telescope, calling it a helpful and weird piece of data. Next, there is a very brief, low-frequency musical cue, almost like a sound effect, before the man continues speaking.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a person wearing a blue hoodie, seated in front of a bookshelf filled with various books and collectibles, including a map on the wall. The individual appears to be speaking, using hand gestures to emphasize their points. The scene transitions to an outdoor setting, showcasing a large observatory dome situated on a mountain peak, surrounded by clouds during sunset. The sky transitions from orange to dark blue, indicating the passage of time from dusk to night. The observatory dome is illuminated, and the Milky Way becomes visible in the night sky, highlighting the observatory's role in astronomical research. The video then shifts to a close-up of a colorful, abstract image resembling a spiral galaxy, with red and green hues against a dark background, possibly representing a scientific visualization of a celestial object. The scene returns to the person in the blue hoodie, who continues to speak, with the bookshelf and map in the background. The video concludes with the person still speaking, maintaining the same setting and attire, suggesting a continuous narrative or discussion related to astronomy or science.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker noting, "This shouldn't have happened," describing a telescope that spotted an object but wasn't designed for that purpose. He conveys a tone of surprise and intrigue. He suggests that such events are likely common, counter to expectations, and states, "We were off by like orders of magnitude." His tone shifts to optimism, explaining that more instances offer future study opportunities because, "We definitely do not understand what this thing was." He then contemplates whether a "solar sail-like object" might naturally form in the galaxy.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person wearing a blue hoodie with white drawstrings, seated in front of a bookshelf filled with various books and collectibles, including figurines and a framed map on the wall. The individual appears to be speaking and gesturing with their hands, indicating an engaging conversation or presentation. The scene transitions to a movie clip showing a young girl in a dark jacket and a patterned hat, holding a doll, interacting with a large, hairy creature. The text 'After 30 Films' appears in the top right corner, suggesting a film review or discussion. The video then returns to the person in the blue hoodie, who continues to speak and gesture, maintaining the same background setting. The atmosphere is casual and intellectual, with the person likely discussing topics related to the film or other subjects of interest.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with the sound of someone saying the name "Oumuamua." This is followed by a male speaker discussing the tendency to jump to conclusions about aliens when faced with confusing phenomena, citing Carl Sagan's assertion that "extraordinary claims require extraordinary evidence". The speaker then mentions Oumuamua again and notes that the evidence to support such claims is lacking. As the speaker continues, a cat meows loudly in the background.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a person wearing a blue hoodie with white drawstrings is seated in front of a bookshelf filled with various books and collectibles. The individual is actively engaged in a conversation or presentation, using hand gestures to emphasize points. The background features a colorful map on the wall, adding a vibrant touch to the setting. The person's facial expressions and body language suggest they are explaining or discussing a topic with enthusiasm and clarity. The environment appears to be a personal study or office space, characterized by a cozy and intellectual atmosphere. Throughout the video, the person's gestures and expressions convey a sense of engagement and passion for the subject matter being discussed.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a single male speaker who sounds analytical and uses conversational tone to discuss two arguments against the "extraterrestrials created a light sail hypothesis," focusing on its tumbling motion and relatively slow speed. He explains that it's impractical for studying planets and inefficient for interstellar travel.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person wearing a blue hoodie with white drawstrings, seated in front of a bookshelf filled with various books and collectibles, including figurines and a framed map on the wall. The individual is actively gesturing with their hands, indicating they are speaking or explaining something. The scene transitions to a view of Earth from space, showcasing illuminated city lights against the dark backdrop of space. Following this, an asteroid is depicted floating in space, illuminated by a bright light source, possibly the sun. The video then returns to the person in the blue hoodie, continuing their discussion or presentation in the same setting. The atmosphere throughout the video is educational and informative, with a focus on the individual's explanation and the visual aids provided by the images of Earth and the asteroid.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker, in a thoughtful and speculative tone, discussing "alternate hypotheses". He suggests the presence of more shipwrecks under the ocean than floating ships, possibly connected to something broken down or attacked. He touches on the idea of interstellar war. Following this, there's a shift to a brief, loud explosion-like sound effect, creating a sense of impact. The speaker then returns, now in a more reflective mood, mentioning the commonality of debris floating in the galaxy. Speculation continues as the speaker suggests the object may be tumbling slowly to be seen, proposing that it could be an "interstellar greeting card". After a disclaimer, the speaker self-consciously questions making the video at all, citing credibility as a science show host.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a person wearing a blue hoodie with white drawstrings is seated in front of a bookshelf filled with various books and collectibles, including figurines and board games. The individual is actively engaged in a conversation or presentation, using hand gestures to emphasize points. The background features a colorful map on the wall, adding a vibrant touch to the setting. The person's facial expressions and body language suggest they are explaining or discussing a topic with enthusiasm and clarity. The environment appears to be a personal study or office space, characterized by a cozy and intellectual atmosphere. Throughout the video, the person maintains eye contact with the camera, indicating a direct engagement with the audience. The lighting is bright and even, highlighting the details of the room and the individual's expressions. The video captures a dynamic and informative interaction, with the person's gestures and expressions conveying a sense of passion and knowledge about the subject matter.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a single male speaker discussing the significance of observing an interstellar object, noting they may be more common and weirder than previously thought. He then shifts to pondering the profound impact of discovering such an object originates from "somewhere else, someone else." His tone is speculative and inquisitive. He transitions to a more analytical tone, commenting on the potential impact of a captivating idea on how scientists consider a hypothesis, and how the public perceives it. The audio clip concludes with a brief acknowledgement from the speaker.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a person wearing a blue hoodie, seated in front of a bookshelf filled with various books and collectibles, including figurines and a framed map on the wall. The individual appears to be speaking, as indicated by their hand gestures and facial expressions. The scene then transitions to a depiction of a large, irregularly shaped asteroid floating in space, surrounded by stars and cosmic dust. The asteroid is shown from different angles, emphasizing its rough texture and dark color. Following this, a spacecraft with a large, reflective, square-shaped solar panel is depicted, with Earth visible in the background, suggesting the spacecraft's journey through space. The video then returns to the asteroid, now illuminated by a bright light source, possibly the sun, casting a glow and creating a dramatic contrast between light and shadow on its surface. The video concludes with the asteroid continuing to float in space, with the light source still visible in the background, highlighting the vastness and mystery of the cosmos.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single male speaker, presenting information in a fairly academic tone, discussing concepts such as headlines, video content, and click rates in the context of science communication. He mentions phrases such as "this is probably not a spaceship" and highlights the potential for audiences to focus on the "probably" rather than the "is not". He continues discussing the hypothesis that the object Oumuamua may have been constructed by an intelligence outside of our solar system, noting the propensity for people to focus on that idea more than other explanations.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a mesmerizing view of a comet, its tail streaming behind it as it orbits a bright star, set against the backdrop of a star-filled sky. The scene transitions to a graphical representation of a solar system, with blue lines depicting the orbits of planets around a central star, and a comet's trajectory marked by a white line. The dates '2017.39' and '2017.69' appear, indicating the comet's passage through the solar system. The comet's path is shown in detail, with its tail becoming more pronounced as it moves closer to the star. The scene then shifts to a person in a blue hoodie, sitting in front of a bookshelf filled with books and various items, including a map on the wall. The person appears to be speaking, with their facial expressions and gestures indicating engagement in a conversation or presentation. The video maintains a focus on the person, with the background remaining consistent, emphasizing the indoor setting and the person's interaction with the audience.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features one male speaker expressing his desires for a spaceship and a newsworthy event, not of the bad kind but the big kind. He admits to not trusting himself sometimes, wanting things to be a certain way. He notes the event was ephemeral and now all there is to do is speculate. He follows up by stating "or maybe that isn't true".

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a serene view of a sunset, showcasing a gradient sky transitioning from deep orange near the horizon to a darker hue above, with a silhouette of a large dome structure on the right. Stars start to appear in the sky as the sun sets. The scene then shifts to a construction site on a mountain, where a large building with a green roof and a circular structure is under construction, surrounded by construction equipment and materials. The camera provides an aerial view of the site, highlighting the circular structure and the extensive scaffolding and construction materials around it. The video continues with a closer aerial view of the construction site, focusing on the circular structure and the surrounding scaffolding, with the text "LSST" visible in the top left corner, indicating the project's name. The scene transitions to a wider aerial view, showing the entire construction site with the circular structure, scaffolding, and various construction materials, including a large crane and a partially constructed building with a green roof. The video concludes with a closer aerial view of the partially constructed building, emphasizing the ongoing construction work and the surrounding mountainous terrain.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing telescopes and the potential of observing objects like Oumuamua more frequently in the future. He expresses the hope that this could lead to understanding and even visiting such objects, or alternatively, that they might remain rare phenomena. The speaker's tone is informative and optimistic, concluding that either outcome would be "a big deal."

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a mesmerizing view of a spiral galaxy set against the backdrop of the vast cosmos. The galaxy, with its bright core and swirling arms, is surrounded by numerous stars of varying sizes and colors, creating a stunning contrast against the dark expanse of space. The spiral arms of the galaxy are adorned with clusters of stars and nebulae, adding depth and texture to the scene. As the video progresses, the camera zooms in slightly, offering a closer look at the intricate details of the galaxy's structure and the surrounding celestial bodies. The overall atmosphere is one of awe and wonder, highlighting the beauty and complexity of the universe.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing the alien hypothesis, stating that "maybe the best argument" against it is "simply that the universe is weird," delivered in a conversational tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a mesmerizing view of a galaxy set against a backdrop of stars, showcasing its spiral arms and bright core. The scene transitions to a person wearing a blue hoodie, seated in front of a bookshelf filled with books and various items, including a map on the wall. The person appears to be speaking, as indicated by their mouth movements and hand gestures. The video then shifts to another individual in a gray hoodie, also seated in front of a bookshelf with a similar setup, continuing the narrative with expressive hand movements. The scene transitions to a colorful graphic with the text 'PROJECT FOR 2018 AWESOME' and the website 'PROJECTFORAWESOME.COM' along with the dates '12/7 - 12/9', suggesting a promotional event. The video returns to the person in the gray hoodie, who continues to speak and gesture, emphasizing their points. The video concludes with a black screen displaying the text 'NASDAILY' in bold white letters, indicating the end of the video.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker, in a calm, reflective tone, musing about unexplained phenomena in the night sky, with the phrase "oh, this is it." He mentions science catching up with observation and describes a unique object, then signs off to "John." He then switches to a more upbeat tone, mentioning preparation involving articles, podcasts, and videos linked in the description. The speaker thanks the scientists who worked on the project, addressing the education videos' exemption to the "four-minute rule," and then mentions "project is awesome," hyping up a voting event for charity videos. He ends with excitement about the "project is awesome," expresses thanks for the educational video exemption, and closes repeating the previous sign-off.
